### Load data
#### USDA food data

```{r load-data, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# Load data
df <- read.csv("archetypes/usda-food-data/usda-food-data-src.csv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
df <- within(df, rm(ndb))
df

```

#### Filter on food products

### Plot Ternary-facet
#### USDA National Nutrient Database

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width = 1920/72, fig.height = 1080/72, out.width = "100%"}

theme_opts <- theme(
  text = element_text(family = "inconsolata", size = 16), 
  plot.title = element_text(color = "black", size = 16, face = "bold"),
  plot.subtitle = element_text(color = "black", size = 12),
  plot.caption = element_text(color = "#555555", size = 10),
  legend.position = "bottom",
  legend.title = element_blank(),
  tern.axis.title.L = element_text(size = 16, hjust = 0.5),
  tern.axis.title.R = element_text(size = 16, hjust = 0.5),
  panel.background = element_blank(),
  panel.border = element_blank(),
  plot.background = element_blank(),
  plot.margin = unit(c(0, 0, 0, 0), "in")
)

pal <- wes_palette("Zissou1", 10, type = "continuous")

v1 <- ggtern(data=df_wrangle, aes(protein, carbohydrates, fat)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = calories, size = calories), alpha = 0.6) + 
  scale_color_gradientn(colours = pal) + 
  scale_size_continuous(guide = FALSE) +
  coord_tern() +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme_nomask() +
  theme_opts +
  labs(title = "USDA National Nutrient Database", 
           subtitle = "by food group") +
           xlab("Protein") + 
           ylab("Carbohydrates") +
           zlab("Fat") +
  facet_wrap(~ food_group, nrow = 1)

girafe(ggobj = v1, width_svg = 1280/72, height_svg = 720/72,
      options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0)))

```


```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# Full Size
ggsave(filename = "assets/usda-food-data-fs.svg", plot = v1, width=1280/72, height=720/72)

# Small
ggsave(filename = "assets/usda-food-data-sm.png", plot = v1, width=4, height=2.25)

```
